description: T7. Birch (Betula pendula)South boundaryLarger of the two specimens. Crown reduce by approximately 30% (3min height and 2m in lateral spread) resulting in a 6m high tree T6. Birch (Betula pendula)South boundarySmaller tree. Crown reduce by approximately 30% (3m in height and 1min lateral spread) resulting in a 5m high treeT2-T5. LondonPlanes (Platanus X hispanica) x4South boundary Row of large mature trees previously reduced overhanging adjacent gardens ofBelgrave Road. Reduce back to most previous points of reduction (3m in height and 3m in lateral spread. (Re pollard) Resulting in new heights of 10m in all cases. T2a. London Plane (Platanus X hispanica)South boundary Smaller tree with no history of crown reduction. Reduce canopy all round by 30% (2m in height and 2m in lateralspread) Shape and balance. Resulting in a 7m high tree
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
